{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3624866,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-15T01:29:57.528Z","cooked":"

For the past few days I tried to make some CAN sensor using Arduino + mcp2515 and had some good result. There were many past attempt on CD to make custom CAN stuff but none of them had enough documentation. Thatâ€™s why I am sharing some of my work.

github.com

GitHub - sikaxn/FRC-Custom-CAN-Sensor

main

Contribute to sikaxn/FRC-Custom-CAN-Sensor development by creating an account on GitHub.

f82c79cad8da5bf90882fcda3b9d87a1702Ã—1276 220 KB

Here are some of the stuff I manage to achieve

  • Analog input from Arduino to roboRIO
  • Digital input from Arduino to roboRIO
  • REV Colour sensor V3 connected to Arduino i2c to roboRIO with fault detection
  • roboRIO control digital output
  • roboRIO control servo PWM (NOT legal to use in FRC)
  • Sensing roboRIO heartbeat on Arduino

Your suggestion is wanted. Hope this project would provide the community some new idea with CAN. However with the new SystemCore coming I do believe most of these would stop woring with the new MRC unless major update to the code.

If you want to debug these code, a CAN analyzer is necessary. Personally I use CANalyst-II. However I would recommand getting a CANable this one is easier to acquire in North America. (I had my friend hand carried my CANalyst-II from China). If you donâ€™t want to invest into a CAN analyzer, REV Hardware Client do have a built in CAN Data function which could let you see CAN frame. However to use the Arduino simulator in my code a CAN adapter supporting python-can is necessary.

image1004Ã—453 51.9 KB

In additon to this post, Iron Maple Public Project Discord server will have a dedicated custom-can channel in case you want to message me in the channel.

Sweet! I developed an ESP32 based custom CAN board for our collegeâ€™s solar car club, with the intention of getting it to interface with the FRC can spec at some point. This project might actually push me to update itâ€™s software to talk to a RIO.

image842Ã—690 93.2 KB

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-15T04:15:12.376Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":523,"readers_count":522,"score":149.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501764,"topic_slug":"custom-can-sensor-some-good-progress","display_username":"NatsirtD","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.bridgersolar.com/home","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Bridger Solar Racing","clicks":8},{"url":"https://github.com/Bridger-Solar-Team/Luminous-Lemon-CAN","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - Bridger-Solar-Team/Luminous-Lemon-CAN: BST car code 2014-26","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33937,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2412/16750 alum"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-sensor-some-good-progress/501764/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3625023,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-15T05:17:55.638Z","cooked":"

The most important part of having it interface with roboRIO is to figuring out the message ID.

Per FRC specification message ID consist of multiple piece of information. Most importantly, device number and API ID. This is very preparatory to FRC compared to all other CAN bus implementation.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

FRC CAN Device Specifications

This document seeks to describe the basic functions of the current FRC Â® CAN system and the requirements for any new CAN devices seeking to work with the system. Addressing: FRC CAN nodes assign ar...

Anyway, good luck working on it. What I did before writing the actual firmware is use python and CAN analyzer to mock the protocol. Thatâ€™s why I have the simulator. But once you figure out how the message ID work things will get much easier.

Also be very careful when configuring bus speed. If youâ€™re transceiver is not set to 1 Mbps this could bring the entire CAN bus down and CAN analyzer will not work.

This is excellent!

Is there any reason you use a Timer for polling rather than making ArduinoCAN extend SubsystemBase and read the packets in periodic()?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-16T17:40:21.251Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":406,"readers_count":405,"score":91.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501764,"topic_slug":"custom-can-sensor-some-good-progress","display_username":"Riley Brewer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54372,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Head coach 4911"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-sensor-some-good-progress/501764/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3626400,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-16T19:19:40.258Z","cooked":"

There were multiple trial and error and ChatGPT and copy and paste in the processâ€¦

but most importantly CAN is asynchronous, which means no matter what roboRIO is doing, controller on the other side is keep sending the data. Unfortunately CAN.readPacketLatest() only gives the most recent frame (unlike notifier in python-can which uses an event loop or creates a thread to read messages from the bus and distributes them to listeners). This is a workaround to get over this limitation so we could pull CAN data at a higher frequency in case of loop overrun.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-16T19:20:45.587Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":389,"readers_count":388,"score":87.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501764,"topic_slug":"custom-can-sensor-some-good-progress","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://python-can.readthedocs.io/en/main/notifier.html#notifier","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Notifier and Listeners - python-can 4.5.1.dev11+g5d62394 documentation","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":54372,"username":"krylez","name":"Riley Brewer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/krylez/{size}/176730_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-sensor-some-good-progress/501764/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3626454,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-16T19:32:00.477Z","cooked":"
NathanZhou:

Unfortunately CAN.readPacketLatest() only gives the most recent frame

In many use cases, likely including yours, this is fine (and desired). Instead of actively polling for messages and updating member variables (which may not even be read by the user) in a separate thread, you could retrieve the latest message in the getter functions and extract the data at that point. (Side note- this would also bypass the need to implement mutexing around the cache variables to prevent simultaneous access, something your implementation is missing)

If reading every message matching a given message ID and mask is actually desired, you can use the CAN stream functions. These donâ€™t have quite as nice an API on the Java side (being mostly direct wrappers around the C HAL api), but theyâ€™ll allow you to read every message without high rate polling.

github.wpilib.org

CANJNI (WPILib API 2025.3.2)

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.hal.can, class: CANJNI

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-16T19:39:19.237Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":374,"readers_count":373,"score":79.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501764,"topic_slug":"custom-can-sensor-some-good-progress","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/hal/can/CANJNI.html#openCANStreamSession(int,int,int)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"CANJNI (WPILib API 2025.3.2)","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | Redux Robotics| 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-sensor-some-good-progress/501764/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3626539,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-16T19:48:57.269Z","cooked":"

My method is really just a workaround as I had a headache when trying to implement CANJNI (so many compilation error) that I lost patient. But thatâ€™s was my origional thought (which didnâ€™t workout). However I would give this another visit later.

I just done some update to REVColourSensorV3 .

// === CAN Constants ===
#define DEVICE_ID        0x0A  //DONOT CHANGE
#define MANUFACTURER_ID  0x08  //DONOT CHANGE
#define DEVICE_NUMBER    33  // Device Number 0-63
#define STATUS_API_ID        0x180
#define COLOR_SENSOR_API_ID  0x184
#define CONTROL_API_ID       0x190
#define DT7_API1_ID          0x185
#define DT7_API2_ID          0x186
#define DT7_API3_ID          0x187
#define HEARTBEAT_ID         0x01011840

uint32_t makeCANMsgID(uint8_t deviceID, uint8_t manufacturerID, uint16_t apiID, uint8_t deviceNumber) {
  return ((uint32_t)(deviceID & 0xFF) << 24) |
         ((uint32_t)(manufacturerID & 0xFF) << 16) |
         ((uint32_t)(apiID & 0x3FF) << 6) |
         (deviceNumber & 0x3F);
}

  // Precompute and print CAN IDs
  STATUS_ID        = makeCANMsgID(DEVICE_ID, MANUFACTURER_ID, STATUS_API_ID, DEVICE_NUMBER);
  COLOR_SENSOR_ID  = makeCANMsgID(DEVICE_ID, MANUFACTURER_ID, COLOR_SENSOR_API_ID, DEVICE_NUMBER);
  CONTROL_ID       = makeCANMsgID(DEVICE_ID, MANUFACTURER_ID, CONTROL_API_ID, DEVICE_NUMBER);
  DT7_FRAME1_ID    = makeCANMsgID(DEVICE_ID, MANUFACTURER_ID, DT7_API1_ID, DEVICE_NUMBER);
  DT7_FRAME2_ID    = makeCANMsgID(DEVICE_ID, MANUFACTURER_ID, DT7_API2_ID, DEVICE_NUMBER);
  DT7_FRAME3_ID    = makeCANMsgID(DEVICE_ID, MANUFACTURER_ID, DT7_API3_ID, DEVICE_NUMBER);

Now itâ€™s easier to generate message ID with FRC CAN Specification!

In addition, I created an GUI tool for message ID to FRC CAN spec

Important: Please donâ€™t change

#define DEVICE_ID        0x0A  //DONOT CHANGE
#define MANUFACTURER_ID  0x08  //DONOT CHANGE

As this will result roboRIO side stop working with the current codebase unless you add deviceManufacturer and deviceType when initialization on roboRIO side (I havenâ€™t done it yet). Those value above are the default roboRIO use.

    public ArduinoCAN() {
        can = new CAN(33, deviceManufacturer, deviceType);
        startPolling();
    }
github.wpilib.org

CAN (WPILib API 2025.3.2)

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj, class: CAN

What is the transceiver you use with your ESP32? Is it TJA1050? Iâ€™m having one ESP32 talk to two separate CAN bus and found out I am having more trouble on TJA1050 bus.

RFID battery tracking, progress updates (video demo update) Control System
a progress update: roboRIO driver is mostly completed. roboRIO now can read battery information and send data to arduino. [image] Something i figure out is the documentation of FRC Can Spec say time and date is included in heartbeat. however decode towards those field turns out to be match time countdown. struct [[gnu::packed]] RobotState { uint64_t matchTimeSeconds : 8; uint64_t matchNumber : 10; uint64_t replayNumber : 6; uint64_t redAlliance : 1; uint64_t enabled : 1; uint64â€¦

I am experiencing some issue when decoding CAN heartbeat. Specifically for Time of day part of the heartbeat. Instead of the actual time of the day, that section of my heartbeat represent match time countdown (if using practice mode). I am not sure if this behaviour will change if FMS is connected but this doesnâ€™t align with the documentation.

@Ryan_Blue sorry for the mention but do you have any clue?

Itâ€™s here! I got this mostly working, only some minor bugfix! A ESP32 CAN enabled Addressable LED Controller! Fully customizable!

image3024Ã—4032 1.13 MB

github.com

FRC-Custom-CAN-Sensor/Arduino/addressableLED at main Â·...

Contribute to sikaxn/FRC-Custom-CAN-Sensor development by creating an account on GitHub.

This controller have support of built in pattern or pixel by pixel update from roboRIO.

Please read the full documentation for how to set it up and how to create your own pattern! Be very careful with pixel by pixel mode (Mode 255) as it could create a huge amount of CAN traffic (45% CAN util for 60 pixel). It is recommanded that you create your own pattern in ESP32 and call it using mode setting instead of doing pixel by pixel update from roboRIO. (Log below is a rainbow pattern that utilize all 8 message)

image1274Ã—605 12.2 KB

Please checkout roboRIO example as well.

github.com
